citation.article-title: Legionella gresilensis sp. nov. and Legionella beliardensis sp. nov., isolated from water in France.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Legionella gresilensis sp. nov.
Legionella gresilensis (gre.si.len'sis. M.L. adj. gresilensis pertaining to Gréoux, a French spa city, whose classical Latin name was Gresilium)
Gram-negative rod with a single polar flagellum.
Positive for catalase, oxidase, gelatinase, hippurate hydrolysis and presence of β-lactamase.
Negative for urease, nitrate reduction, acid production from dglucose and browning of tyrosine agar.
DFA and SAT results indicate no serological cross-reactions with any Legionella species.
All strains were isolated from water samples in France.
The type strain is Gréoux 11 D13T (=ATCC 700509T=CIP 106631T), isolated from a thermal spa water in the city of Gréoux (France).
It has a G+­C content of 33 mol%.
Strains Mulhouse 12 A22 (=ATCC 700758) and Mulhouse 12 A23 (=ATCC 700759) are additional strains of Legionella gresilensis.
